DataElement.preferredDefinition: A categorization of the disposition events which is used to distinguish between disposition events, protocol milestones and other events.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to disposition._A classification of disposition data.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to disposition.

Concepts.definition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to disposition.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

ValueDomain.preferredName: CDISC SDTM Category For Disposition Event Terminology Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Terminology codelist used for Disposition Event within the Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium Study Data Tabulation Model._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The group of incidents that are not driven by the protocol but that may occur during a clinical trial and describe whether a subject completed the study epoch or the reason this event did not occur.

Concepts.definition: The group of incidents that are not driven by the protocol but that may occur during a clinical trial and describe whether a subject completed the study epoch or the reason this event did not occur.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Occurrences within some epochs that are initiated by a protocol-specified event. The most common protocol milestone is "Informed Consent Obtained" which usually documents the start of the study.

Concepts.definition: Occurrences within some epochs that are initiated by a protocol-specified event. The most common protocol milestone is "Informed Consent Obtained" which usually documents the start of the study.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The group of incidents that occur during a clinical trial and describe whether a subject completed the study epoch or the reason this event did not occur. The subject's disposition is often described for each phase of the study.

Concepts.definition: The group of incidents that occur during a clinical trial and describe whether a subject completed the study epoch or the reason this event did not occur. The subject's disposition is often described for each phase of the study.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: This would most commonly be a heading on the CRF or screen, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. This is used to distinguish a DISPOSITION EVENT, a PROTOCOL MILESTONE, or an OTHER EVENT.

ReferenceDocuments.description: What was the category of the disposition?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Case Report Form Completion Instructions
ReferenceDocuments.description: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor provides instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

ReferenceDocuments.name: DSCAT
ReferenceDocuments.description: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable.
